alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued November 24 at 7:08PM HST until November 26 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF BIG ISLAND... .Surf along exposed north and west facing shores will gradually lower through the weekend as a significant northwest swell moves through. Heights should dip below the advisory levels by Monday. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 25 to 35 feet, lowering to 20 to 25 feet Saturday for north facing shores. Surf of 18 to 25 feet, lowering to 15 to 20 feet Saturday for west facing shores. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Surf will steadily lower through the weekend, likely dropping below warning level by early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Very High...Expect ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, coastal benches, and lava flows creating the potential for impacts to coastal properties and infrastructure, including roadways. Powerful longshore and rip currents will be present at most beaches. Large breaking waves and strong currents will impact harbor entrances and channels causing challenging boat handling dangerous. &&
